message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,700,000. It's a fantastic opportunity for you, and I'm sure you'll see the value in this deal.  Let me know what you think!

I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, but I'm afraid I'm not willing to pay $1,700,000. I was thinking more along the lines of $1,200,000. I believe that's a fair price considering the market value of similar products.

Bob, I understand your perspective on the price. However, $1,200,000 simply wouldn't cover my costs. I'm willing to come down to $1,550,000 to make this deal work.  This price is still fair considering the value and potential of this product.  Let's see if we can find common ground.

Alice, I understand you're trying to make a profit, but I'm still not comfortable with $1,550,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm offering $1,300,000. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $1,300,000 is still too low for me. I'm willing to compromise further, but I need to stay above $1,400,000 to make this deal work. Let's try $1,450,000 as a final offer. I'm confident this price reflects the value of the product and leaves room for us both to benefit.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $1,450,000 is still a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm offering $1,350,000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value and my budget.
